{"step_by_step_thinking": "The researchers reviewed a database of women who were known to be BRCA-mutation positive and divided the group into those with breast cancer and those without breast cancer. They then compared the proportion of each population that had undergone a bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy. This type of study design involves comparing groups with and without a specific outcome (breast cancer) and looking back in time to determine exposure (bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy). Therefore, the study design described is a case-control study.", "answer_choice": "C"}
